interactions.Alarm:
The user, a 25-34 year old male working professional from Australia, frequently interacts with the alarm assistant to manage his weekday morning routine. Past interactions show a consistent pattern of setting a recurring alarm for 7:30 AM on weekdays, with a preference for a gradually increasing alarm sound to gently wake him up.

Initially, the user would simply ask the assistant to "set an alarm for 7:30 AM tomorrow" or "set a weekday alarm for 7:30 AM". Over time, as the assistant learned his preferences, the user began using more concise commands like "weekday alarm" or even just "alarm", relying on the assistant to apply the preferred 7:30 AM time and gradual sound.

On occasions when the user had to start work earlier, he would temporarily adjust the alarm time, asking the assistant to "change tomorrow's alarm to 6:45 AM". He also sometimes requested the assistant to "skip the alarm on Saturday" for weekend sleep-ins.

The user appreciates the assistant's ability to confirm alarm settings and provide reminders the night before. He has occasionally provided feedback, such as "the alarm sound was a bit too jarring today" or "thanks for waking me up on time as usual".

While the user's core alarm preferences have remained consistent over time, he has explored additional features like setting multiple alarms for different purposes (e.g., "set a second alarm for 8 AM to remind me to take my medication") or linking alarms to smart home devices (e.g., "turn on the bedroom lights when the alarm goes off").

Overall, the user values the assistant's reliability, simplicity, and personalization capabilities for his daily alarm needs, allowing him to start his workday on time without disrupting his routine.
